alert.note: Alert for Bent; Kiowa; Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 9:30PM MDT until July 07 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Bent County in southeastern Colorado... Central Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... Western Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 1230 AM MDT. * At 930 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving south across Central Kiowa county. This heavy rain will move into eastern Bent and Prowers county through 10 pm. Flash flooding will be possible along highway 50 and highway 287, and also in the city of Lamar. County roads in the warning area will also likely see heavy rains capable of flash flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lamar, Eads, Wiley, Haswell, McClave, Hasty, Neegronda Reservoir, John Martin Reservoir, Sweetwater Reservoir, Queens Reservoir, Neeoshe Reservoir, Blue Lake, Caddoa and Fort Lyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
